snippet: On popular Web sites, misinformation about antipiracy legislation amounted to an abuse of trust and a misuse of power.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Cary H Sherman, chief executive of the Recording Industry Association of America, argues that the popular Web sites that helped drum up opposition that doomed online antipiracy legislation essentially manufactured a controversy by unfairly equating the bills to censorship; asserts those Web sites engaged in amounts to an abuse of trust and a misuse of power.
lead_paragraph: On popular Web sites, misinformation about antipiracy legislation amounted to an abuse of trust and a misuse of power.
